title: tropical storm leslie hurricane heading uk
story: With wind speeds of mph and even stronger gusts, the storm is now looking much more severe than previously predicted.Extremely powerful hurricane-force winds are already extending  miles from the centre of the vast storm, with slightly weaker tropical-storm-force winds covering a whopping  mile area.Storm Leslie is in the middle of the Atlantic right now.It is forecast to head north towards the US over the next couple of days - before changing direction and barrelling off towards Europe on Sunday.Previous reports of the strengthening storm said that Britain could expect fierce gales and torrential rain as the storm moved eastwards towards Europe, although its exact path was yet to be confirmed.Now weathermen have confirmed that the storm is heading our way, with charts showing the storms path curving menacingly up towards Britain.A Met Office Spokesman told The Sun Online: “Quite often by the time anything comes anywhere near the UK, all we’re left with is a bit of energy in the system rather than anything that vaguely resembles a hurricane.“But at the moment it’s far too early to say exactly where it will track and what stage it will be at as it crosses the Atlantic.“As it starts moving in our direction, we’ll get a better idea of how near to us what’s left will come, whether there’s anything that will affect our weather at all.“And it’s not likely to come in our direction till next week, probably mid-to late I would think, but it’s still a fairly fluid situation at the moment.Brian Gaze, director and forecaster for the Weather Outlook, told The Sun Online: Its too early to be certain about the impact of Storm Leslie on the UKs weather, but at the moment it looks like tracking to our northwest.That means a northwest to southeast split in the weather would be likely.In the north west of the UK there is the potential for it to turn very wet and windy.Areas farther south and east could remain dry, and possibly become very warm for the time of the year as tropical air embedded in the system crosses the UK.Some computer models show temperatures pushing up towards the mid Cs in the south east.However, it is too early to discount the chance of the wet and windy weather extending farther southeastwards.The enormous hurricane winds will blow over a huge  mile area, with less intense winds reaching as far as  milesEffects wont be felt in the UK until next week after Leslie has moved up towards the America.The National Hurricane Center in Miami has warned that large swells and rip tides could be le-threatening as the brutal storm closes in on the southeastern coast of the United States along with Bermuda and the Bahamas in the next few days.Before Leslies effects are felt in the UK, the south east is in for another warm spell today and for the next few days.The Met Office said: Given a good spell of sunshine we could see a C or C in London today, and tomorrow it will be similar.We could be looking at a C or C even on Thursday and Friday.The south east will also see the highest temperatures over the weekend.A weather front from northern Scotland will head down across the country on Thursday bringing some potentially heavy rain but winds will be mostly slow moving.Another front from the northwest will then descend to the southeast on Friday which could mean stronger downpours in northern England and Wales, as well as southern Scotland.The weekend is generally going to be cloudier and cooler, with rains following the weather fronts.It should dry up in the south east of England on Sunday but it will be a cold and bright day.

title: idiots attempt to dive into a swimming pool from a roof ends in a spectacular faceplant
story: Video footage of the unidentied man leaves viewers wincing as he misses the water by inches, and his body slams the ground.It is not as yet known where or when the stomach-churning footage – shared on social media – was filmed, or what injuries he suffered.The video shows a half-naked man standing on the roof of a changing room, after climbing up a ladder.Pals appear unfazed as he lines himself up for the jump with one even talking casually on his mobile phone.But as the man walks down towards the gutter, with his head tipping forward, he raises his arms and plunges too soon.Arms flailing in the air, the wannabe er smashes through the guttering and lands on all fours while his head bounces on the hard concrete surrounding the swimming pool.The footage blurs as those watching and filming his painful stunt yell out and rush to help the man, who appears to be knocked out as a result.The six-second video has been widely shared on social media in recent days.

title: theresa may dances onto stage for tory party conference speech
story: The PM poked fun at her Maybot image as she got her groove on to Abbas Dancing Queen before appealing to the party to get behind her.And in a blast at Boris Johnson, Mrs May warned that anyone obsessed with getting the perfect Brexit risk leaving us tied to the EU forever.She also took a pop at the top Brexiteer over his f**k business jibe - vowing to back business instead.In the hour-long address, the PM:She admitted that the public needed to see that their hard work has paid off after struggling with cuts to public services in a bid to balance the countrys books.But in a blow to MPs who want to see her gone, Mrs May insisted she has a plan for the next year and beyond.The address received a massive standing ovation from activists, as husband Philip walked on stage and kissed her while ELOs Mr Blue Sky played over the PR.In her speech in Birmingham, the PM gave a spirited defence of her Chequers plan which has ided MPs and activists.She said: “We will not betray the result of the referendum, and we will never break up our country.“I have treated the EU with nothing but respect. The UK expects the same.”The PM added that her plan would respect the referendum while minimising the economic dangers.She said: “It delivers on the referendum. It keeps fair with the British people. It is in the national interest.”Hitting out at hard Brexiteers such as Boris Johnson, the PM added: Those of us who do respect the result, whichever side of the question we stood on two years ago, need to come together now.If we dont -we all go off in dferent directions in pursuit of our own visions of the perfect Brexit - we risk ending up with no Brexit at all.In a second dig at Boris - who has overshadowed the conference by making his own alternative leadership pitch - Mrs May said Tories shouldnt be saying f**k business as he did earlier this year.She said: To all business - large and small - you may have heard that there is a four-letter word to describe what we Conservatives want to do to you.It has a single syllable. It is of Anglo Saxon derivation. It ends in the letter K. Back business!Mrs May vowed to bring an end to austerity after a decade-long financial squeeze, telling hard-pressed voters: “The end is in sight.”Praising the fall in the deficit, she added: “This is a historic achievement - but getting to this turning point wasn’t easy.“Public sector workers had their wages frozen, local services had to do more with less, and families felt the squeeze.“Fixing our finance was necessary - there must be noto the uncontrolled borrowing the past, no undoing all of the progress of the last eight years, no taking Britain back to square one.“But the British people need to know that the end is in sight. And our message to them must be this - we get it.”The PM revealed the Government will turn on the spending taps again next year once theyve finished the job of cutting a Brexit deal with Brussels.And she delivered a love letter to Britain, listing the countrys achievements and adding: Dont let anyone tell you we dont have what it takes.Mrs May also launched a blistering attack on Jeremy Corbyn - warning that Tories have a “duty” to keep him out of power.The PM said the Labour boss was making Jewish Brits feel unsafe in their own country and claimed the party has lost its moral backbone.Mrs May said: “The Jeremy Corbyn party rejects the common values that once bridged our political ide.”She added: What has befallen Labour is a national tragedy.She went on: What has it come to when Jewish families today seriously discuss where they should goJeremy Corby becomes Prime Minister That is what Jeremy Corbyn has done to the Labour party. It is our duty, in this Conservative party, to make sure he can never do it to our country.THERESA May tried to overcome last years disastrous conference speech by making a string of jokes about it.After she came on shimmying to Abbas Dancing Queen - mocking her cringey dance moves form a recent trip to Africa, she joked that some could even have been inspired to become professional dancers after seeing her moves. months ago Mrs May was forced to stop several times before while she tried to clear her throat.But laughed it off today, telling the audience: Youll have to excuse meI cough during this speech.The PM has been suffering with a snfle for the last few days, sparking fears of another spluttering disaster.And she quipped on the backdrop which came down last year: Ive been up all night super-gluing the backdrop.Mrs May also made a stinging joke about her ex-Cabinet colleague Boris Johnson, who gave a barn-storming speech to activists yesterday.A few months ago he caused uproar by reportedly uttering the words f**k business.But lashing back, Mrs May said today: And to all business - large and small - you may have heard that there is a four-letter word to describe what we Conservatives want to do to you.It has a single syllable. It is of Anglo Saxon derivation. It ends in the letter K. Back business.After talking about her Housing Secretary James Brokenshire’s treatment and recovery from cancer, the PM revealed her own goddaughter died from the disease last year.She said: “Cancer can strike any of us at any time.“A few years ago my goddaughter was diagnosed with cancer.“She underwent treatment and it seemed to be working, then the cancer came back.“Last summer she sent me a text to tell me she was hoping to see another Christmas. But she didn’t make it.”Senior Tories hailed the PM’s speech - comparing it favourably to last year’s total meltdown.Jeremy Hunt said: “Congratulations Theresa May for a remarkable speech delivered with humour and passion.“Firmness of purpose, clarity and conviction - EU friends do not underestimate!”And Downing Street chief of staff Gavin Barwell quipped on Twitter: “Waited  months for that #outthepark”.But Labour dismissed her speech as empty rhetoric - shadow minister Gavin Barwell said: Try telling local government across England there’s an end to austerity... deep cuts to our public services are continuing and they have Theresa May’s fingerprints all over them!And Lib Dem boss Vince Cable joked: “As somebody who takes dancing seriously, I was delighted to see Theresa May show that she is developing her new hobby. But she was dancing on the head of a pin, confronted by an audience full of people plotting to oust her.The PM said during her conference speech: “Something’s changed for the worse. Rigorous debate between political opponents is becoming more like a confrontation between enemies.“People who put themselves forward are becoming targets, their families as well.“We all saw the sickening pictures of a far-left extremist shouting abuse at Jacob Rees-Mogg’s children.“And it’s not only Conservatives who are facing abuse the first black woman ever to be elected to the House of Commons receives more racist and misogynist messages today than when she first stood over  years ago.“You don’t have to agree with a word Diane Abbott says to believe passionately in her right to say it free from threats and abuse.”Ms Abbott, the Shadow Home Secretary, welcomed her nice words but lashed out at the Tories for deliberately targeting her with their adverts during last years election.She tweeted: Some nice words from Tory leaders like Theresa May and Sajid Javid. Makes you wonder who was responsible for the Tory party’s relentless personal attacks in the general election campaign .Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: tesla cars parked mysterious locations us
story: Internet sleuths have flown drones and even private planes over car parks to take the shots of rows and rows of vehicles in Calornia, New Jersey, Arizona, Utah and other locations.The amateur detectives have this week shared the snaps on Twitter.The pictures have again fuelled doubts Musks firm can make the jump from making luxury sports cars powered by electricity to becoming a major automaker.Its share prices tumbled lately amid reports it was missing production targets.And many on social media say the unearthed photos largely of  Model s cars, said to be taken at regular intervals since July, suggest something is still amiss at Tesla.Some claimed the share price will continue to plunge.There are  Teslas sitting at the Union Pacic Railroad in SLC. My car is one of these. Ive been told I was getting delivery the th, then the th, then the th, then the nd, and now my delivery has been delayed indefinite. @Tesla @elonmusk...Please make this right, read one angry tweet, suggesting delivery problems are to blame for the parked cars.Elon Musk responded personally to one customers concerns, writing on Twitter: Sorry, weve gone from production hell to delivery logistics hell, but this problem is far more tractable. Were making rapid progress. Should be solved shortly.But Dave Arnold, spokesman for Tesla, told The Times the parked cars were logistics transit hubs.Anyone observing those lots will see a change from one day to the next, he added.Tesla delivered , vehicles in the third quarter but Musk insists he intends to increase this rate.The -year-old dad even claimed last week he has been sleeping on factory floor in Fremont, Calornia, in a desperate bid to oversee the efforts to make more cars.He also said the company has developed its own trailers to transport cars to customers.However, Musk was told this week he must step down as Tesla chairman and fined £million after settling a deal with US regulators over tweets about taking the company private.The US Securities and Exchange Commission charged the billionaire with misleading investors with tweets on August  that said he was considering taking Tesla private.The tweets had no basis in fact, and the ensuring market chaos hurt investors, it claimed.

title: 5 ways theresa mays tory
story: News ways Theresa Mays Tory conference speech will never be as amazing as last yearIn the hall in Manchester it seemed that everything that could possibly go wrong didShareCommentsByNicola BartlettPolitical Correspondent:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT News "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailIt will be almost impossible for Theresa May to deliver a worse speech than last year. In the hall in Manchester it seemed that everything that could possibly go wrong did. When the Prime Minister was interrupted by a P prankster, you would have been forgiven for thinking that was dramatic enough. But after trying to recover her composure Mrs May succumbed to a painful coughing fit which left her audience waiting for what felt like hours. Limping through to the end she might have thought she was home and dry but the set had other ideas. As Tory members dutully applauded letters spelling out a crucial message behind Mrs May began to fall down. Here are  bombshell moments from last year to relive before Mrs May takes to the stage today. . A prankster handed over her P  In the middle of the Prime Ministers address, notorious prankster Lee Nelson got up on stage and handed her a mock P. At first Theresa May didnt skip a beat but she stopped as he was marched out by security to cries of “out! out! out!” from party faithful. Tory activists gave her a standing ovation in solidarity as she quipped: “I wanted to talk about someone I’d like to give a P to and that’s Jeremy Corbyn !” Speaking to journalists, Nelson, whose real name is Simon Brodkin, said: I gave a P to Theresa. I thought he [Boris Johnson] wanted me to hand it to her.  Boris asked me to. I don’t know why, you’ll have to ask him. Boris said in one of those corridor meetings Do me a favour and give Theresa this. He was seen being led out of the building in handcuffs, and was subjected to a body search by security officers. A security probe has now been launched. A senior No  source said: “Greater Manchester Police have arrested a man for a breach of the peace. “We expect that there will be a thorough investigation into whats happened.”Watch the moment prankster Lee Nelson hands P to Theresa May on stage during Tory party conference speech. She suffered a world-beating coughing fit  Theresa May struggled to complete her keynote speech after she was hit by a nasty coughing fit live on stage. The Prime Minister has been suffering from a heavy cold throughout the partys annual conference in Manchester. But it really kicked in halfway through her headline speech - forcing her to stop several times to cough, drink water and accept a cough sweet from Chancellor Philip Hammond. Members gave her a standing ovation as she was unable to continue saying the words “record numbers of jobs”. As Philip Hammond helped her out with a lozenge, the Prime Minister said: “I hope you notice that ladies and gentlemen, the Chancellor giving something away free!”  Given the coughing, she appeared to leave out a pertinent line in the speech. The written version provided to the media included the words: I rely on the NHS. I believe in the NHS. The Prime Minister skipped that part. Downing Street sources tried to shrug off the cough-filled performance by the Prime Minister. “The PM has got her conference cold a little early,” a senior source admitted. “But she is fine, since she’s been here she’s done  interviews and spoken at  receptions.” A source said she was “happy” and clapped back into the room by staff.  Theresa Mays speech to Conservative Party Conference was such an epic, multi-faceted disaster that even the backdrop fell apart before her eyes. In one final, brutal indignity, two letters fell off the backdrop on stage. The stage set originally bore the slogan Building a country that works for everyone. But the letter F gave up the ghost, falling to the floor in a desperate bid to escape the excruciating car-crash event. It was closely followed by the letter E.  By the end of her speech, it read: Building a country that works or everyon. Downing Street sources were at a loss to say how the letters fell off. Questions on whether there was glue austerity went unanswered.  Tory Amber Rudd appeared to angrily order Boris Johnson to give Theresa May a standing ovation during her disastrous car-crash of a conference speech. She struggled to complete the speech, beset by persistent coughing fits and a croaky voice. When the cabinet rose to their feet to applaud Mrs Mays waking nightmare, rival Boris Johnson needed a little encouragement. And the moment the Home Secretary appeared to angrily order him to stand up and clap was captured live on national TV.

title: tory conference slogan two little
story: NewsTory conference slogan has two little words missing - and they say everything you need to knowAll you need to do is compare this years slogan to the one David Cameron used in . Can you spot the dference ShareCommentsByDan BloomOnline Political Editor:,  OCT NewsHere is Tory Philip Hammond with this years conference slogan "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailTheresa May is today addressing a Tory party conference beneath a one-word banner: OPPORTUNITY.Its a funny old slogan. Opportunity can pretty much mean anything - any political promise, any unreachable goal. A bit, a cynic might say, like Brexit . If you feel its all a bit woolly, then in fact, youre not wrong. All you need to do is compare this years slogan to the one David Cameron used in .Heres Theresa May, then the Home Secretary, standing underneath it. Can you spot the dference   Thats right. The slogan was security, stability, opportunity. That was in . Before the Brexit vote. Before David Cameron was ousted. Before Theresa May lost her majority in the  election. title: tory gandalf geoffrey cox upstages
story: NewsTory Gandalf Geoffrey Cox upstages Theresa May with baffling, booming Tory conference speechThe Attorney Generals speech was unexpectedly rousing - and hes suddenly a future Prime MinisterShareCommentsByMikey SmithPolitical reporter:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news politics video tory-gandalf-upstages-theresa-may-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailYou may not have heard of Geoffrey Cox. Butyou were in Birmingham this morning, youve probably heard his voice. Hes the Tory Attorney General, and more importantly, the warm up act for Theresa Mays keynote speech to Conservative Party Conference. And to be honest, he didnt need a microphone. Most residents of the Midlands could have popped their heads out of an upstairs window and heard his booming, silken tones wafting on the wind. Prior to his speech this morning, Mr Cox was perhaps best known for being Westminsters most well paid MP.  But despite earning six figures on top of his MPs salary - and remembering to try to claim a pint of milk on expenses - he gave up his side gig as a high flying barrister to take the job of Attorney General, the Governments top lawyer. Quoting John Milton, he spoke optimistically about post-Brexit Britain, saying: Methinks I see in my mind a noble and puissant nation rousing herself like a strong man after sleep, and shaking her invincible locks. Methinks I see her as an eagle mewing her mighty youth, and kindling her undazzled eyes at the full midday beam.  Almost as soon as he took to the stage, he was compared to a string of classical English actors, including Sir Ian McKellen, Brian Blessed and Patrick Stewart. And before he even sat down, bookmakers were giving odds on him being the next Prime Minister. Heres some of the best reactions to Geoffrey Coxs unexpectedly popular Tory conference speech.

title: what tory brexit going look
story: NewsopinionThis is what the Tory Brexit is going to look likeTheres bad news for borders, badgers and BorisShareCommentsByFleet Street FoxColumnist:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsopinion"Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThere are  days until Brexit, theyve got a full tank of prats, half a pack of loons, theyre doomed and theyre wearing blue rosettes. Welcome to the Conservative Party conference of , where the Tories are trying to pretend they can organise a knees-up that doesnt somehow end in whacking themselves in the testicles.Its day one, and theyve already failed. Their Great Blond Hope has not only been victim of a Big Daddy splash by Lord Digby Jones, hes been impersonated by Phil Voldemort Hammond and had his ideas characterised as not much good by David Mine Are No Better Davis.We are now uncomfortably close to the arbitrary date for leaving the European Union, chosen by a Prime Minister who herself was chosen because she wasnt someone , and as is the way with things on horizons it looks worryingly like an out-of-control hydrogen explosion.We all know whats happened - the referendum supposed to uny the Tories has caused them to turn on each other like cannibals who gave up chlorinated chicken for Lent, the question supposed to be settled for a generation remains unanswered, and Theresa May is still PM primarily because she isnt someone .So what is Brexit going to look like, under the Tories  . Project Oh Dear Jeremy Hunt is a man who has more in common with an Anglepoise lamp than the rest of the human race. He can be pointed, turned on, and turned off again, but usually fails to illuminate anyone. He is now second-favourite to be Prime Minister next year, which should be adequate proof of just how boked the Tories are.Boris is trolling, Sajid and Gavin are manoeuvring, Chris Grayling is in a siding outside Melton Mowbray and Hunt - a man who, the Leveson Inquiry heard, tried to hide behind trees to avoid journalists while still being visible to them - is now, let me say it again, one of the favourites. Its a bit like saying the green Opal Fruit is your favourite. Or that the USSR, which invaded countries that tried to leave it and killed millions, is just like the EU, which negotiates, even with people who dont know what theyre doing. . Project You Cant Be Serious  Having toured the country in a bus promising to give our EU subscription to the NHS, the Tories have since said: a well still have to pay a subscription b it will be higher, without a rebatec by the way, well be cutting pound.bn off the NHSToday the spiritual leader of the Brextremists has suggested we spend our foreign aid budget on saving elephants, because they remind him of Beethovens Fth Symphony. Hang the education projects, stuff the small-scale charities who exist entirely because of foreign aid, and lets get all worked up about the  pence in every pound national profit that we spend on foreigners. Boo hiss to foreigners! Elephants are British! Wait, what  . Project Is This Really The Best You Could Do  Brexit, the Tories are assuring us and their donors, will mean a bonfire of unnecessary rules and regulations about meaningless, bureaucratic tripe like child car seats, not getting killed at work and hiding your money from the taxman.It gives us a chance to set our own rules such as only banning dangerous cladding  months after it burned  people alive, and onlyits on new buildings, which means all the people living in older properties can go sizzle.It also wont matteryou sleep surrounded by highly-flammable material on the sixth floor, oryou dont have a sprinkler system, or the fire exits are blocked or non-existent. After Brexit, you wont want to live anyway. . Project Genuine Fear  The government of the UK is trying to exit a union it doesnt want while protecting one that it does. To do so they are relying on a referendum they say must be respected, while ignoring a referendum they say must be over-ridden.All the people concerned were told beforehand that Brexit would spell the end of the Good Friday Agreement, a hard-won peace in Northern Ireland, and possibly the end of the Union altogether. That they have now,  months from doom, had this explained to them again by a comedian shows just what a bad joke the Tories are.Patrick Kieltys dad was murdered by the Ulster Freedom Fighters for exposing their organised crime. The Tories border solution involves asking those self-same people to pretend theres a border where there isnt one, and file paperwork well in advance before smuggling guns, drugs and people across  miles of hedge that we cant police. Laugh  Youll die. . Project It All Onto Someone Else Presiding over economic chaos  Watching John Lewis go down the pan, the world turn against you, and Jacob Rees-Mogg destroying all his own suggestions by moving his investment funds to the EU and trying to get a trade deal with the Peoples Republic of Jam Jar Or Something Like That  Well, why not shoot some more badgers. Not in the head, thats too quick. Kneecap them and watch them suffer. Burn some cattle, bankrupt some farmers, blame it all on the EUs crazy rules about bovine TB which isnt harmless so long as you pasteurise your milk, mostly doesnt kill cows and could easily be stopped with a vaccineonly we could be bothered.When someone says but Brexit means we can abandon these rules! Save the badgers! point out we still have to abide by EU ruleswe want to sell beef, milk or cheese to the EU. And dont, for heavens sake, let anyone say that the only way to change those rules is to, er, remain in the EU.With a Tory Brexit, hard or soft, youre looking at Jeremy Hunt being in charge while making swingeing NHS cuts, making it quite the worst reboot of a franchise since Indiana Jones And The Hospital Of Doom.Youll see people burning in another tower block before long, a fresh wave of terrorism when we havent dealt with the current one, and Tories blaming badgers, migrants, and anything  that moved because, after Brexit, theyll no longer be able to blame the EU. The Tories have spent the past  years blaming Europe for all the things they cocked up themselves. Without the EU, people are going to blame the Tories. Which is why their days are numbered.

title: brand beckhams more crass class
story: NewsopinionBrand Beckhams more crass than class after swerving speeding fine and celebrating with £, wineWith his speeding and brash lestyle, David Beckham is trashing his own imageShareCommentsByAlison PhillipsColumnist:,  OCT NewsopinionDavid Beckham dodged a speeding conviction on a technicality "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email Oh David … where did it all go wrong When did you disappear so far up your own exhaust pipe that you thought launching a top of the range luxury car days after wheedling your way out of a speeding charge was decent behaviour  When did you begin believing your superiority meant you could post a sickeningly smug selfie grumbling about London traffic on the day your case appeared before court  And when did you start thinking your  million followers on Instagram would be entertained that very evening by snaps of you celebrating pulling a fast one on British justice with a pound, bottle of wine  Because whenever it was – the time has certainly arrived when the British public are sick, sore and sorry of you and your publicity junkie family. Some say the rot set into David’s ego the moment he posed in those ludicrous thrones at his OK! themed wedding to Victoria .Perhaps it even pre-dates that, to the dreadful matching leathers look. Only a monstrous ego would enable anyone to leave the house looking like that. Let alone let their partner leave the house in the same outfit.  More recently there has been David’s penchant for spending his leisure time huntin’ and fishin’ dressed up like the Lord of the Manor in pound welliesJust who does this boy from Leytonstone in East London think he is  And I don’t say that because there’s anything wrong with coming from Leytonstone. There’s everything right with coming from Leytonstone. But everything wrong with pretending that you don’t. And by hiding the reality of your le under layers of flash clothes and flashier mates you become the kind of person we Brits instinctively distrust. Some say the warning bells were there in David’s behaviour as far back as that petulant World Cup kick two decades ago.  Certainly by last year the warning bells had become klaxons when emails between him and a publicist were leaked in which he raged about deserving a knighthood from the Queen’s honours committee. ‘Unless it’s a knighthood, f*** off,’ he wrote.Even Beckham’s speeding lawyer Nick ‘Mr Loophole’ Freeman admits ‘from a moral standpoint’ Beckham was in the wrong and only escaped on a technicality when he’d been doing mph in a mph zone.

story: NewsMan, , is youngest in UK to be diagnosed with dementia - after watching it destroy his mumWhile the young man has no signs of the illness now, doctors have told him he could lose the ability to walk, talk and eat for himself at any timeShareCommentsByJames Somper:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news video -year-old-man-becomes-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA -year-old man is believed to be the youngest adult in the UK ever diagnosed with dementia after inheriting the disease that killed his mother. Jordan Adams from Redditch, Worcestershire, has been told the chances of getting his condition are less than winning the EuroMillions and says he has been incredibly unlucky. Although he has no signs of the illness now, doctors have said he could lose the ability to walk, talk and eat for himself at any time. He has also been told his le could end in his fties, like his mum Geri, who died at the age of .  Jordan was told he would develop early onset frontotemporal dementia and Parkinson’s Disease after inheriting a gene - which caused the degenerative conditions - from his mum. Last month, doctors gave the entrepreneur the crushing news he had a rare mutation of the MAPT gene, which causes the condition. And he has been warned his health will deteriorate as he gets older. He now plans to have his sperm screened for the gene so he and girlfriend Lucy Thomas, , can start a family before his symptoms develop.  Jordan also plans to tick travelling to Hawai, buying a house, and doing a skye off a bucket list. He said: “When I was told the diagnosis I was devastated. “We had been in the waiting area for what seemed like hours – it was only  minutes but it felt like an eternity. “As soon as I walked into the room I knew it wasn’t a positive result. “Nobody can prepare you for that. “If there are no advancements then I’ll have a shorter le than most. It’s like a death sentence. “Its very hard to explain. Were all dealt cards in le and I was just incredibly unlucky.  Jordan was given the news he had tested positive for the gene when he and sister Kennedy,  decided to get themselves checked after watching mum Geri deteriorate over a period of six years. He was finally given the results on September  after three gruelling months of consultations and blood tests. Jordan said he saw the full impact of the disease while caring for Geri, as he watched her lose the ability to talk, walk and eventually eat and breathe for herself. Her family first noticed something was wrong in , when she suddenly began acting out of character. However she was not diagnosed until  and sadly passed away in . Jordan said: “Mum was full of love and very much a people person. “No one had a bad word to say about her, she was very kind and lovely. “We’d noticed irregularities in her behaviour. I remember one Saturday she went to pick up Kennedy from school but it was a weekend. “Her character changed from being a loving woman and she became quite cold. “She seemed to lack compassion which was a huge change from when she’d covered us in love. “She slowly got stripped of her communication. She couldn’t talk a lot and then she began to lose her mobility and couldn’t go out alone. “As the disease progressed she lost the ability to walk and care for herself and for the last  months she was bedridden. It was heartwrenching.”  Jordan said that despite his initial shock, he and girlfriend Lucy have discussed plans for their future together and that he feels like his diagnosis will give him a unique perspective on le. They are considering having IVF when they decide to start a family as the process will allow doctors to screen his sperm for the dementia-carrying gene. Jordan said: “I feel like the diagnosis is actually a licence to live. “It’ll make me step back and appreciate the bigger picture. It’s going to allow me to make choices to live a fulfilled le. Lucy added: “We’ve decided that it’d be probably best to have children first and then get married. “We know it’s dferent to how most people would it do but it’ll give Jordan more time with his kids. “It’s hard to deal with knowing he won’t be there one day but it’s important to retain perspective. “We will have a le together despite everything.”

story: NewsMeghan Markle jokes about “amazing British weather” on first visit to Sussex with Prince HarryThe Duke and Duchess of Sussex visited the county bearing their titles where they were greeted by hundreds of adoring and excited localsShareCommentsByRussell Myers:,  OCT NewsMeghan and Harry arrive at Edes House in Chichester during an official visit to Sussex "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailMeghan Markle joked about the “amazing British weather” on her first visit to Sussex with Prince Harry today. The Duke and Duchess of Sussex visited the county bearing their titles where they were greeted by hundreds of adoring and excited locals. On their first stop of a packed day of engagements the royal couple visited the market town of Chichester where they casually spent more than  minutes chatting and joking with the crowds who had gathered. Prince Harry and his we Meghan were seen laughing and joking with royal fans, with the Duchess even remarking on “this amazing British weather” as the sun shone during their arrival. Harry playfully ruffled the head of a baby in the crowd and bent down to lovingly stroke a golden retriever as Meghan attentively spoke to some local schoolchildren from the Prebendal School. Meghan Markle and Prince Harry: LIVE as Duchess gives husband dreamy look of love during Sussex visitOne seven year old told Meghan, who was dressed immaculately a camel Armani coat, a dark green Hugo Boss skirt and shirt from And Other Stories paired with nude suede stilettos, he had been “waiting for her since before school time”, to which the Duchess softly replied “well, I am so grateful, it is so lovely to meet you”. Local resident Sally Harper, , who shook hands with Meghan said: “They are just the loveliest couple, we feel very proud to have them come to our county which is of course their county too and to see them spend so much time with all the children is very special, we love them.” A group of pupils from Westbourne House School also gathered in West Street in the centre of Chichester who had brought gts for Harry and Meghan. Classmates Kieran Rutherford and Thomas Symington, both ten, presented Meghan with an A to Z of Sussex made by pupils at the school. It includes pictures of famous local produce like English wine, historic landmarks and beauty spots.Thomas said: We want to tell them all about Sussex because it is the best county in the world.  The royal couple who flew in by helicopter this morning were greeted by Susan Pyper, Her Majesty’s Lord Lieutenant of West Sussex and Martyn Bell, the Mayor of Chichester. The royals walked  yards down West Street to Edes House, the magnicent Georgian mansion in the market town to be greeted by Caroline Nicholls, High Sherf of West Sussex Lionel Barnard, chairman of the local county council and Elizabeth Hamilton chairman of the district council. Inside the Grade  listed building, which dates from  which is mainly used for weddings and civic s throughout the year, Wendy Walker, the West Sussex archivist, proudly showed them the rare Sussex copy of the American Declaration of Independence. The declaration, stored in the local records office but displayed especially for the royal visit, is one of only two contemporary handwritten ceremonial manuscript copies, the other being the signed copy housed in the National Archives in Washington D.C. It was originally delivered to the town in  by solicitor Leslie Holden who worked for local firm Rapers and collected many local historical documents throughout his le. At the time the company were the solicitors for the Duke of Richmond, whose family seat is Goodwood House in West Sussex. The document is thought to have been held by the rd Duke of Richmond who was known as the “Radical Duke” for his support of the Americans during the Revolution.  Mrs Walker told Harry and Meghan how “it was drawn up in America, possibly in New York or Philadelphia” - to which the Duchess simple exclaimed “wow, that’s really special”. However, it was not until  that document’s true signicance was discovered when further research and testing revealed it dated back to the s.It is the most valued declaration other than the Matlack Declaration, which is signed by the American forefathers held in Washington.Harry diligently asked about the history of the document and seemed incredibly impressed when told of the signicance of the manuscript. He said: “That is absolutely amazing, so interesting.”

story: NewsMum tells how daughter,, was swept to her death by "freak ft wave" as they walked along the beachRose Carter, from Salisbury, Wiltshire, was on a family walk at Durdle Door, Dorset when the youngster was struck by an eight-foot waveShareCommentsByBen Mitchell:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsAn inquest has found the death was a tragic accident"Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email A distraught mother has described to an inquest the moment her five-year-old daughter was swept out to sea by a freak wave while walking at the Durdle Door beauty spot.Rose Carter, from Salisbury, Wiltshire, was with her sister and her mother, Sofia Carter, at the Dorset beach on April  when the youngster was hit by the ft wave. The Coastguard was alerted and a military vessel helped rescue her, but she was pronounced dead at Dorset County Hospital in Dorchester. Mrs Carter, who did not attend the Bournemouth hearing, said in a statement that the sea was rough but she did not think it was dangerous as they walked along the edge of the beach with Rose about ft behind her.  She said: I saw a really big wave that went over her head and knocked her off her feet. Mrs Carter said a second wave then also knocked her into the water and she added: When I stood up I could no longer see Rose. Rose was beyond the breaking waves and I was aware a lady called  and a military boat was there within minutes. A man with binoculars directed the boat to where Rose was. Rose was taken from the sea. She added: Rose was a strong child and happy in the water and was able to swim with doggy paddle and had previously swam s. Witness Lucy Seviour described how she had been taking part in coastal climbing nearby when she was hit by the wave.  She said: I saw Rose had been knocked flat by the waves and was being pulled in by the riptide and was half or three-quarters of the way down the beach and that was within a second. Ms Seviour, who used to do triathlons, said that she went into the water in an attempt to rescue Rose but was swept back to the beach by the waves that fractured one of her ribs. She said: I could see Rose for half a second and she was only half a metre away but I tried to move and was washed up on the beach. Ms Seviour said that she then tried to stop Mrs Carter from going into the water but added: Obviously its her kid so she went straight back in. She said that Roses sister was terried. Another witness, Gordon Cobb, said he heard Mrs Carter screaming: My daughter, my girl or my baby, and added: I could see a little girls head sticking out of the wave, physically there was no way she could have got through the wave. I had to watch her drt out to sea. Describing the wave as ft high, he added: The sea was very dangerous that day and the wave that hit the girl was a freak wave and came out of the blue, and no other wave was like it before.

title: russian instagram model boiling water
story: NewsRussian Instagram model has boiling water thrown over her chest by fellow inmate jealous of her glamorous looksKira Mayer is shocked by le behind bars, craving oysters and wanting to have hotel service from her cellShareCommentsByWill Stewart:,  OCT NewsInstagram celebrity Kira Mayer,  "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email A Russian Instagram “princess” who was jailed after reportedly offering traffic police a threesome to turn a blind eye to her motoring offence claims a fellow inmate poured boiling water over her chest. Model Kira Mayer, , claimed she was victimised behind bars with many prisoners resenting her glamorous looks.Her chest was scalded “to the bone” in the alleged attack and months after the incident she still has a “red bleeding scar,” she said. She claims she got into a row with her cellmates who expected her as a “newcomer” to clean the cell and toilet. And the social-media star is shocked by le in prison in general - and says she wants to be fed oysters and have hotel service.  Speaking of the alleged attack, Mayer said: “Its been two months now, there was a deep burn to the bone. “And here they did not even give me any special medication to treat this. “I was just sent to the punishment box. “Im not a rebel, but I was strongly against the pressure on ‘newcomers . Despite reports that she suffered facial injuries the model revealed to a human rights monitor that the serious wound was to her chest. Human rights monitor and prison visitor Eva Merkacheva - also a prominent Russian journalist - wrote: “Incredibly, she manages to look the same behind bars as she looks in her Instagram. “Long hair, and huge doll-like eyelashes.”  The prisoner, used to tropical photoshoots and exotic holidays, said: “I’m always beautulthe media visit me.” And Mayer has not let the incident prevent her from making a series of extraordinary demands from warders in her Moscow detention centre ahead of her move to a penal colony for her  month sentence. But insistence on being served oysters and deliveries from top restaurants has not gone down well. Mayer said: When they brought me some strange porridge for breakfast, I asked: Can I have a hot croissant, orange fresh, mixed omelette and cheese  “I thought it was possible to order food here like in hotel. They laughed. “Next, they have such ugly metal bowls here. I cant eat from them, I’m afraid.” She said she only eats on plastic plates delivered by her family. “I am offering to introduce a paid service for delivery from restaurants so that they can bring oysters and fish, she said. “I want oysters so badly.”  She complained: “My bed is made of metal bars. “I asked for a normal one with an orthopaedic mattress, and they laughed at me again. It also turned out phones are not allowed here. I used to have three mobile phones and was on Instagram all the time. “I askedI could get even the most basic iPhone with internet but they laughed at me even more.” Mayer pleaded guilty to assaulting a traffic police officer who stopped her driving her Mercedes without a licence on the way to a manicure in Moscow. She offered a threesome to the officer and his colleaguethey ignored her motoring offence, according to reports citing law enforcement sources. The policemen “declined her offer and detained her”, it was reported.  From her cell she admitted to Merkacheva that she was “very afraid” of jail. Later she said she “told myself I had to continue living. “Now I almost dont cry,” said Mayer, ex-girlfriend of Russian pop-singer Alexey Vorobyov. “My regular le is gone. “I was on the way to my manicure - but ended up in a detention jail.” She said: “Only now do I realise I used to live like a princess. “I spent the whole summer behind bars, its sad. “I want to go to the Seychelles. “I do breathing exercises and it makes it better. “Half of my fellow inmates didnt like me straight away for my looks. “The other half were asking me all sorts of girly questions.”  She also blamed her female judge Katerina Kirichenko for her “harsh” sentence, claiming she “did not like me”. “In our country you can go to jail simply because you annoy someone,” she said. She admitted trying to hide the fact that she had been jailed “but it leaked out”. She said: “I realised that jail might be good and will increase my popularity.” Her latest ploy is to suggest a hair selling business to her jail governor.

title: school installs pedals under pupils
story: NewsSchool installs pedals under pupils desks to help obese children lose weightWhile youngsters are practising their reading and arithmetic skills, they pedal away on the floor-mounted bikes to stay in shapeShareCommentsByJim HardyChris kitching:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror incoming video obese-student-loses-half-body-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:,],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email A primary school has installed pedals under pupils classroom desks so they can cycle and stay healthy as they learn. Its all part of a bid to fight childhood obesity in Britain, where almost one in five children are overweight or obese when they begin their studies.Within two years, almost half of all children in Britain will be overweight or obese, experts have warned. While youngsters at Red Oak Primary School in Lowestoft, Suffolk, are practising their reading and arithmetic skills, they pedal away on the floor-mounted bikes to stay in shape.  The aim is to encourage them to lead a more active lestyle amid the countrys obesity crisis. It had been launched in a year three class for pupils aged seven and eight. Staff are so pleased with the outcome, its now being rolled out to a further  children in years one to six at the school. The exercisers have a digital display that shows exercise time duration, calorie consumption and revolutions per minute.  They were bought with some of the PE and sport premium funding and topped up from the school budget. The school has now placed an order to buy more pedals as they extend the programme to  other classes. PE co-ordinator and year three teacher Johnny Lee said: I had heard of schools in America using the pedal bikes during sedentary lessons, which led to improved levels of concentration after using the equipment and increasing activity throughout the day. We call it our active classroom. The desk pedals have seen the children cycle during their English, maths, ICT and French lessons to make them fitter and increase their daily physical activity.

title: uk weather forecast storm leslie
story: NewsUK weather forecast: Storm Leslie to batter Britain with TWO WEEKS of gales and wintry downpoursStorm Leslie is strengthening in the Atlantic and could hit Britain by the end of next weekShareCommentsByNeil MurphyKelly-Ann Mills:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news uk-news video storm-leslie-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailStorm Leslie will whip up vicious winds and unleash a torrent of wintry downpours when it hits Britain later this month - with TWO WEEKS of gales forecast.The unsettled front will arrive at the same time as the UK is hit by plunging temperatures as some forecasters even predict an early winter freeze for early October.Experts say the low pressure system could make itself felt until the end of the month, with two weeks of turbulent weather potentially bringing transport woes for commuters. The tropical storm is currently strengthening in the mid-Atlantic and is expected to develop to hurricane strength by tomorrow.  Storm Leslie has dramatically veered eastwards and is on course to hit northern Europe by the end of next week. The low-pressure front has the potential to bring powerful winds and stormy conditions as schools close for Autumn half-term. Met Office chief meteorologist Andy Page said: “Leslie will likely strengthen to a hurricane as it moves over warmer waters with large swells affecting Bermuda and east coast of the United States and the Caribbean.  “It is likely to gradually weaken after this and move eastwards across the north Atlantic. “Some models suggest Leslie will track south of the UK while others suggest it may move close to the UK by the end of next week.” A spokesman for the US National Hurricane Centre has warned the storm will drag a huge sea swell towards Bermuda and the Bahamas before changing direction on a new path towards northern Europe. He said: “Large swells generated by Leslie will continue to affect portions of the southeastern coast of the United States, Bermuda, the Bahamas, and most of the Greater and Lesser Antilles for another day or two. “These swells could cause le-threatening surf and rip currents. The UK is currently bracing for blustery conditions in central and northern Britain this weekend  Rain will be persistent in northern regions and Ireland from Thursday but it should remain dry and overcast for the rest of the country. It will also feel cooler from Friday and any sunshine will be in short supply.Downpours will soak many areas of England and Wales during Saturday andit will be quite windy as the stormy front moves across the country towards the North Sea before clearing overnight into Sunday.However, temperatures will continue to dip with highs struggling into the low teens C. A spokesperson for The Weather Channel said: “A marked front will move over the north-west through Thursday, stalling over northern and central England and Wales during Friday and Saturday. “There will be some cloudy, wet and windy weather, especially on Saturday, associated with that front. “It will finally clear to the near-continent overnight Sunday, but turning much cooler in clearance.”

title: mollie tibbetts man who led
story: NewsMollie Tibbetts: Killer who told police where missing joggers body was claims not enough facts for defenceCristhian Rivera, , has been charged with first-degree murder after the sophmore students body was found in a corn fieldShareCommentsByElaine McCahill:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsThe legal team for Cristhian Rivera, , have said there are not enough facts to mount a defence "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe legal team for the man suspected of killing a jogger have claimed there are not enough facts to prepare a defence at his murder trial. Cristhian Bahena Rivera, , was charged with first-degree murder told police in Iowa, US, after telling where Mollie Tibbettss body hidden under corn stalks. The -year-old went missing on July  while out jogging in Brooklyn, Iowa. After more than a month of searching, investigators found her body in a rural farm field on August .  Now ABC reports Riveras lawyers have filed a Bill of Particulars in which they state the prosecution failed to provide guidance on the element of premeditation. In Iowa, the crime has to be premeditated in order for someone to be charged with first-degree murder. Rivera reportedly admitted to following Mollie while she was out jogging on July . He also allegedly said he got out of the car and started to jog alongside her but blacked out when she threatened to call . The farm worker claimed he then woke up inside his car which was parked at a rural intersection. Mollie was in the boot of the car but he claims he has no recollection of how she got there.  “The defendant cannot ascertain what acts he is charged with,” the motion read. “Without a bill of particulars, defendant cannot prepare his defense to the crime of murder in the st degree.” The motion also says that details of the “method or how the defendant perpetrated the alleged offense” have not been included in the trial information and that the defense lawyers weren’t provided access to crime scene details or the lab results. Authorities said Rivera admitted pursuing the -year-old jogger in his car on July , before parking, getting out of the vehicle and running after her. He reportedly told investigators that the student grabbed her phone and threatened to call cops as he ran alongside her - and he then panicked. The suspect apparently told investigators he came to at an intersection, before realising he had put the jogger in his car boot and opening it up.  He found the University of Iowa student inside the boot with blood on the side of her head, according to the document, written by a sherfs deputy. He then allegedly dragged her out of the vehicle, into a cornfield, before carrying her deeper into the field over his shoulder and putting her down. There, he covered her with corn stalks, the document adds. Rivera, a reported undocumented immigrant who entered the country ilegally, worked at Yarrabee Farms for around four years, where he reportedly gave his employers fake identity documents under a dferent name.

story: NewsMum reveals her unique way of cooking a full English breakfast - and its blowing peoples mindsA mums somewhat controversial way of cooking a full English breakfast has taken the internet by stormShareCommentsByCaitlin OSullivanCourtney PochinAudience Writer:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news video womans-genius-hack-cooking-full-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailEveryone has their own way of doing things. Whether its putting jam on a scone before the cream, or the milk in the tea before adding hot water.But when it comes to cooking a fry-up, youd think the way to do it was pretty straightforward - heat some oil in a pan and get frying. However one mum has proved theres a very dferent way to go about cooking a full English breakfast.Sonia Cheetham, , has come up with a simple and healthy way to give her family a treat before school, reports Liverpool Echo.Instead of throwing the mushrooms and bacon in a frying pan, she puts all her ingredients into a slow cooker. title: infertile pig gives birth litter
story: NewsInfertile pig gives birth to litter of piglets after microsurgery performed by ROBOTSome claim the birth of the six healthy piglets raises new hopes for women struggling to conceiveShareCommentsBySophie EvansZoey McDougall:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsProud mum Rosa is pictured with her litter of piglets "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email An infertile pig has given birth to a litter of healthy piglets following microsurgery performed by a robot.The sow, called Rosa, underwent the operation by a robotic surgeon in south-western Russia earlier this year.Two months later, she was reportedly introduced to a male pig called Boris and quickly became pregnant .And now, she has given birth to six piglets at the Krasnaya Gorkafarm in the countrys Penza Oblast region. Some claim the birth raises new hopes for women struggling to conceive.  Professor Gennady Boriaev, of Penza State Agrarian University, said all the piglets were healthy and two looked like Dad - spotty, like Dalmatians. Both the babies and their mum are said to be doing well. The operation, assisted by Dmitry Pushkar, head urologist at the Russian Ministry of Health, was performed in March. And farm managers are said to be already planning Rosas next pregnancy.  They hope she will deliver more piglets in February or March next year. After this, medical experts may draw a conclusion on the success of the experiment. Doctors claim thatit does prove successful, it could lead to the same surgery being carried out on human patients. The main reason they decided to operate on a pig was reportedly because of the similarity between the animals organs and those of humans.
